content:
That's fantastic! 27 species in a small local park is a great achievement, and it just goes to show how rich and diverse bird life can be in even the most unexpected places. It's wonderful that you're taking the time to observe and appreciate the birds in your area.

Keeping a life list or a park list, as you're doing, is a great way to track your progress, learn more about the birds, and develop a deeper connection with nature. It's also a great way to notice changes in bird populations, migration patterns, and habitat use over time.

I'm sure you've noticed that different species have different habits, habitats, and behaviors, which makes each one unique and fascinating in its own way. Have you noticed any particular species that are more abundant or common in your park, or any that are more elusive or rare?

Also, have you considered sharing your findings with others, such as local birding groups, birding clubs, or even online platforms like eBird? Sharing your observations can help contribute to a broader understanding of bird populations and habitats, and can also connect you with other bird enthusiasts who share your passion.

Keep up the great work, and I'm sure you'll continue to discover more species and learn more about the amazing birds in your local park!
